<@U05S96AE2N8> I don't know why, but in my initial message I totally forgot to mention HubSpot's built in tag filter functionality.

If you have a blog listing page already set up, you can automatically filter the listing page for posts having a certain tag with this URL convention:

domain.com/blogname/tag/tagname

With these types of filters, you just need to display the tag list as buttons with links that go to the correct link to set up tag-level filters

My previous suggestion was for creating a listing page that can scale to any level of filters you need

With some extra HubL, you could also set up a way to filter for posts containing multiple tags: <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/CMS-Development/How-do-I-filter-blogs-with-multiple-Tags-i-e-Tag-1-AND-Tag-2-AND/m-p/347289>
<@U03KAK3R4GY> Ahh okay so that would just go to different pages, not stay on the current one

Well... you can always make it look like you're staying on the current one...

Even this link <https://resilience.com/news> (for example), has a new page load on every filter button click
Is that an out of the box type of functionality ? Or thats custom code?

I think this is the best place for info on how to structure your listing page template: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/building-blocks/templates/blog>

there's sample code for setting up your tag filter pages with `{% if tag %}`
Hi everyone, does anyone have a quick shortcut to convert a HubSpot page into a HubSpot template?

I would recommend learning about the ?developerMode=true parameter you can add to editor links, which HubSpot graciously provided to help us easily copy the HubL for any drag and drop section. <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/building-blocks/templates/drag-and-drop-areas/sections#copy-section-hubl>

Do that for each section & paste  into a custom template

That's the fastest shortcut I know for "converting" a page into a template
